## Description {#details}

A signed pointer, in the ptrauth sense.

Definition at line 1021 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Enumerations

### anonymous enum  {#a1aafc5d3e329d810097927b58f8e9018}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="anonymous enum ">
A constant value for the address discriminator which has special significance to ctors/dtors lowering.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="a1aafc5d3e329d810097927b58f8e9018a4d2079851c19a7b47d074466789d9268" />
<EnumerationListItem name="AddrDiscriminator_CtorsDtors">
 (= 1)
</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

Regular address discrimination can&#39;t be applied for them since uses of llvm.global&#95;&#123;c|d&#125;tors are disallowed (see Verifier::visitGlobalVariable) and we can&#39;t emit getelementptr expressions referencing these special arrays.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h/#l01075">1075</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### getAddrDiscriminator() {#a14dc7cd86f46811c730c459e30ef023b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Constant &#42; llvm::ConstantPtrAuth::getAddrDiscriminator () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
The address discriminator if any, or the null constant.

If present, this must be a value equivalent to the storage location of the only global-initializer user of the ptrauth signed pointer.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h/#l01061">1061</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### hasSpecialAddressDiscriminator() {#a405788d84055c52859a5c238fe35c087}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ConstantPtrAuth::hasSpecialAddressDiscriminator (uint64&#95;t Value) const</>}>
Whether the address uses a special address discriminator.

These discriminators can&#39;t be used in real pointer-auth values; they can only be used in &quot;prototype&quot; values that indicate how some real schema is supposed to be produced.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h/#l01081">1081</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp/#l02127">2127</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp">Constants.cpp</a>.
